snippet: The state and federal health insurance exchanges are emphasizing benefits to sell the Affordable Care Act’s products, but playing down the fees that Americans must pay if they fail to buy.
abstract: State and federal health insurance exchanges, using uplifting taglines and humor to sell benefits of the Affordable Care Act, have consistently played down the fees Americans must pay if they fail to buy;  Web sites, advertisements and even exchange telephone operators have avoided mention of penalty, which polls have shown to be deeply unpopular despite being the financial linchpin of the new program.
lead_paragraph: The state and federal health insurance exchanges are emphasizing benefits to sell the Affordable Care Act’s products, but playing down the fees that Americans must pay if they fail to buy.

headline.main: Talk of Penalty Is Missing in Ads for Health Care
headline.print_headline: Talk of Penalty Is Missing in Ads For Health Care

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
